node.title: Cleo suspect released from hospital, charges expected soon
node.alt: Four men in an ambulance with a man covered by a towel
node.description: A 36-year-old Carnarvon manÂ is expected to be charged imminently over the abduction of Cleo Smith after twice being taken to hospital, with police saying he has not been in a fit state to be charged earlier.
node.content:
["A 36-year-old man arrested yesterday over the disappearance of Cleo Smith remains in police custody after twice being taken to hospital, with charges\u00a0 expected to be laid today.", "He was taken to hospital around midday yesterday and again this morning,\u00a0but the ABC understands he has now been returned to the police station.", "Deputy Police Commissioner\u00a0Col Blanch\u00a0said he did not believe the man had any serious injuries.", "Police minister Paul Papalia has indicated charges could be laid soon.", "\"I think you can, in all likelihood, expect charges today,\" he told ABC News Breakfast.", "\"It is an ongoing investigation.", "\"The taskforce are still working and will be for some weeks on the case.\"", "
Suspect not well enough to be charged
", "Acting Commissioner Blanch said police were hoping to speak to the man soon, but\u00a0needed to wait until he was well enough.", "\"It's taking a bit of time,\" he told Nine Radio.", "\"Police have a very clear role under law to make sure if we are going to interview anyone they must be of sound mind, they must be healthy, must have been fed and must have had sufficient rest.", "", "
Police body camera footage captured the moment officers rescued Cleo.
", "\"So we've got to make all the right accommodations for this person so we can make the right decisions going forward today.\"", "He reiterated\u00a0that taking them to hospital was \"precautionary\" and part of the custodial process.", "Police yesterday said there was \"no family connection\" to Cleo.", "Residents on the street have described to the ABC an overweight man with long, curly black hair.", "\"He was just normal. He would say hello and ask for a smoke,\" one resident said.", "Another resident reported seeing the man coming and going, and he \"always looked like he was in a rush\"."]
